AccelerationMethod.description: The acceleration method of the logical drive

enumDescriptions.ControllerCache: Reads and writes to the logical drive are being cached by the controller.
enumDescriptions.IOBypass: For logical drives on SSDs, read and write information directly from the drive.
enumDescriptions.SmartCache: Reads and writes to the logical drive are being cached by a caching logical drive.

BlockSizeBytes.description: The block size of the disk drive in bytes

CapacityMiB.description: Total usable capacity available on this logical drive in MiB units

DriveAccessName.description: The access ID of the logical drive given by the OS

DriveGeometryCylinders.description: The number of cylinders on the drive

DriveGeometryHeads.description: The number of heads on the drive

DriveGeometrySectors.description: The number of sectors on the drive

enumDescriptions.None: Legacy boot not supported on this logical drive
enumDescriptions.Primary: This indicates that the array controller should provide legacy boot support (Interrupt 13h BIOS support) for this logical drive. The logical drive will be listed as first in the LUN list returned via SCSI commands
enumDescriptions.Secondary: This indicates that the array controller should provide legacy boot support (Interrupt 13h BIOS support) for this logical drive. The logical drive will be listed as second in the LUN list returned via SCSI commands

Links.description: The URIs to the resource related to HpSmartStorageLogicalDrive

ActiveSpareDrives.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageDiskDrive.  This represents the list of drives configured as spare drives for this logical drive and are currently active.

DataDrives.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageDiskDrive. This represents the list of data drives configured as part of this logical drive.

StandbySpareDrives.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageDiskDrive.  This represents the list of drives configured as spare drives for this logical drive and are currently not active.

TransientDataDrives.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageDiskDrive.  This represents the list of drives that are currently transitioning from a data drive to unconfigured or vice versa as part of logical drive transformation operation.

LogicalDriveEncryption.description: True if encryption is currently enabled on this logical drive, false otherwise

LogicalDriveEncryptionDataKeysVolatile.description: True if volatile keys are enabled for encryption, false otherwise

LogicalDriveEncryptionDataKeysVolatileBa.description: True if volatile keys are backed up to a remote key manager, false if volatile keys are not backed up

LogicalDriveEncryptionDataKeysVolatileSt.description: The status of the encryption volatile keys

enumDescriptions.BackupAndSetInProgress: The volatile keys are being set and being backed up to a remote key manager
enumDescriptions.BackupInProgress: The volatile keys are being backed up to a remote key manager
enumDescriptions.DeleteInProgress: The volatile keys are being removed
enumDescriptions.NoOp: No operations are pending for the volatile keys
enumDescriptions.RestoreInProgress: The volatile keys are being restored from a remote key manager

LogicalDriveName.description: Label given to the logical drive

LogicalDriveType.description: How the logical drive is being used

enumDescriptions.Cache: The drive is being used as a cache drive for a different storage drive
enumDescriptions.Data: The drive is being used as a storage drive
enumDescriptions.SplitMirrorSetBackup: This drive is being used as the backup storage drive of a split mirror set after a Split Mirror Array has been performed
enumDescriptions.SplitMirrorSetBackupOrphan: This drive was being used as the backup storage drive of a split mirror set that no longer exists
enumDescriptions.SplitMirrorSetPrimary: This drive is being used as the primary storage drive of a split mirror set after a Split Mirror Array has been performed

MediaType.description: Type of the disk this logical drive is associated with.

InterfaceType.description: The connection interface of the logical drive.

ParityInitializationCompletionPercentage.description: Parity initialization complete percentage for a parity based logical drive (e.g. RAID 5)

ParityInitializationType.description: When creating a logical drive with a RAID level that requires parity, parity blocks can be initialized with two different methods

enumDescriptions.Default: Parity blocks are initialized in the background and the logical drive is available during this time
enumDescriptions.Rapid: Both data and parity blocks are initialized in the foreground and the logical drive will not be available to the operating system until initialization completes

PartitionInformation.description: OS partition information for the drive

Raid.description: The current RAID level configured on the logical drive

enumDescriptions.0: There is no fault tolerance used on this logical drive
enumDescriptions.1: Two sets of duplicate data is being stored on a pair of drives
enumDescriptions.10: Data is duplicated and striped across pairs of disk drives
enumDescriptions.10ADM: Data is duplicated and striped across trios of disk drives
enumDescriptions.1ADM: Three sets of duplicate data is being stored on a trio of drives
enumDescriptions.5: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing parity data across 3 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.50: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing parity data and striping the data across 6 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.6: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing multiple sets parity data across 4 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.60: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing multiple sets parity data and striping the data across 8 or more disk drives

RebuildCompletionPercentage.description: The percent complete for a rebuild operation currently occurring on the logical drive

SmartCacheState.description: The state of the SmartCache cache. This is valid if this drive either is a cache drive, or has a cache drive attached to it

enumDescriptions.Configuring: The caching pair is being configured
enumDescriptions.DDRUnsafe: The DDR is unsafe for the cache drive
enumDescriptions.Destroyed: The cache is destroyed and not functional
enumDescriptions.Limited: The cache is functioning in a degraded mode, and may not be functioning at maximum performance
enumDescriptions.PairFailAtPowerup: The primary and cache drive were unable to be paired at powerup
enumDescriptions.PrimaryLUNOffline: The primary logical drive that is being cached is offline
enumDescriptions.Unknown: The state of the cache is unknown

LogicalDriveStatusReasons.description: A list of logical drive status details

enumDescriptions.Unknown: The state of the logical drive is unknown
enumDescriptions.Ok: The logical drive is in normal operation mode
enumDescriptions.Failed: Indicates that more physical drives have failed than the fault tolerance mode of the logical drive can handle without data loss
enumDescriptions.Unconfigured: The logical drive is not configured
enumDescriptions.Recovering: The logical drive is using Interim Recovery Mode. In Interim Recovery Mode, at least one physical drive has failed, but the logical drive's fault tolerance mode lets the drive continue to operate with no data loss
enumDescriptions.ReadyForRebuild: The logical drive is ready for Automatic Data Recovery. A failed physical drive has been replaced, but the logical drive is still operating in Interim Recovery Mode
enumDescriptions.Rebuilding: The logical drive is currently doing Automatic Data Recovery, where fault tolerance algorithms restore data to the replacement drive
enumDescriptions.WrongDrive: The wrong physical drive was replaced after a failure
enumDescriptions.BadConnect: A physical drive is not responding
enumDescriptions.Overheating: The drive array enclosure that contains the logical drive is overheating. The drive array is still functional, but should be shutdown
enumDescriptions.Shutdown: The drive array enclosure that contains the logical drive has overheated. The logical drive is no longer functional
enumDescriptions.Expanding: The logical drive is currently undergoing a transformation (expansion, shrinkage or movement). During transformation, fault tolerance algorithms redistribute logical drive data according to the transformation operation selected
enumDescriptions.NotAvailable: The logical drive is currently unavailable. If a logical drive is expanding and the new configuration frees additional disk space, this free space can be configured into another logical volume. If this is done, the new volume will be set to not available
enumDescriptions.QueuedForExpansion: The logical drive is ready for transformation (expansion, shrinkage or movement). The logical drive is in the queue for transformation
enumDescriptions.MultipathAccessDegraded: Previously all disk drives of this logical drive had more than one I/O path to the controller, but now one or few of them have only one I/O path
enumDescriptions.Erasing: The logical drive is currently being erased
enumDescriptions.PredictiveSpareRebuildReady: The logical drive is ready to perform a predictive spare rebuild. The logical drive is in the queue for rebuild
enumDescriptions.RapidParityInitInProgress: The logical drive is currently undergoing rapid parity initialization (RPI). The logical drive is unavailable to the operating system during RPI and will be made available once RPI has completed
enumDescriptions.RapidParityInitPending: The logical drive is currently pending RPI and will be unavailable
enumDescriptions.NoAccessEncryptedNoControllerKey: The logical drive is currently encrypted and cannot be accessed because the array controller has not yet received the encryption key nor was it found in the controller's CSP NVRAM
enumDescriptions.UnencryptedToEncryptedInProgress: The logical drive is currently being transformed from unencrypted to encrypted and the volume is online. Data will be written unencrypted if the write is directed to an LBA range on th e logical drive that has not yet been migrated
enumDescriptions.NewKeyRekeyInProgress: The logical drive is currently encrypted and all data is currently being rekeyed with a new logical drive key using the background capacity expansion transformation task. The logical drive is online
enumDescriptions.NoAccessEncryptedControllerEncryptionNot: The logical drive is currently encrypted and cannot be accessed because the array controller does not have encryption enabled
enumDescriptions.UnencryptedToEncryptedNotStarted: The logical drive has received a request to transform from unencrypted to encrypted but this process has not yet started. The unencrypted logical drive is currently online
enumDescriptions.NewLogDrvKeyRekeyRequestReceived: The logical drive is encrypted and has received a request to rekey all data with a new logical drive encryption key. The logical drive is online

StripSizeBytes.description: The strip size of the logical drive in bytes

StripeSizeBytes.description: The stripe size of the logical drive in bytes

TransformationCompletionPercentage.description: The percent complete for any transformations the logical drive may be undergoing such as RAID migration, stripesize migration, capacity expansion etc.

VolumeUniqueIdentifier.description: An identifier (typically SCSI Inquiry based such as Inquiry VPD Page 0x83 NAA 64 identifier) used to uniquely identify this volume.

title: #HpeSmartStorageLogicalDrive.v2_3_0.HpeSmartStorageLogicalDrive
